text:
e="preserve">Thomas Roger Carroll (18 August 1942 – 16 August 2020) was an Irish international footballer.
Carroll was born in Dublin. He was 15 when he made his debut for Shelbourne. He played in the first ever Republic of Ireland U23 game in 1966. He then moved to Ipswich Town in July 1966 and played for the club at right full back for six seasons.
He represented his country 17 times scoring once. He also won three amateur caps.
Carroll died on 16 August 2020, just two days before his 78th birthday.
